intro: Diplycosia soror, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and white, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds, contributing to its propagation. Its roots form specialized structures called haustoria, which attach to the host plant and extract water and nutrients. Despite its parasitic nature, Diplycosia soror plays a role in ecological interactions within its habitat.
